update.description:
In #!/osrf/gazebo/src/abb3930b78f2eae44965211145a911fe140e22c1/gazebo/physics/Entity.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Entity.cc-514 , the `IsStatic` method for light objects is called. 

Unfortunately the static attribute in Light is inherited from the `rootElement` attribute of the World class in #!/osrf/gazebo/src/abb3930b78f2eae44965211145a911fe140e22c1/gazebo/physics/World.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-965 , but in the `rootElement` the `static` attribute is not initialized. 

Given that `static` apparently means "not managed by the physics engine", I think it could make sense to just have the light to be always static, at least based on #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/1920 and #!/osrf/gazebo/issues/900/allow-attachment-of-lights-to-links , but perhaps there are better solutions. 

As in https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/249/fix-memory-leaks/diff#comment-13074157 , I also added a `GAZEBO_RUN_VALGRIND_TESTS` CMake option to debug memory related issues (I found this problem while using this option) . Unfortunately for most of the tests memory issues are detected by Valgrind, but I think the option could be anyway useful to progressively remove this memory issues.
update.title: Fix use of not initialized static attribute in Light class

content.html: Thanks for responding to all my comments! These are really helpful improvements. We will try to set up a jenkins job that runs the tests with valgrind.

pull_request.title: Fix use of not initialized static attribute in Light class

pullrequest.title: Fix use of not initialized static attribute in Light class

content.html:
It seems that the root of this problem is that Entity::isStatic is not initialized in its constructor. I think we should initialize it to false.

diff -r 711376fe8d0d gazebo/physics/Entity.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/Entity.cc  Thu Jan 21 14:45:27 2016 -0800
+++ b/gazebo/physics/Entity.cc  Thu Jan 28 10:41:40 2016 -0800
@@ -56,6 +56,7 @@
 Entity::Entity(BasePtr _parent)
   : Base(_parent)
 {
+  this->isStatic = false;
   this->isCanonicalLink = false;
   this->node = transport::NodePtr(new transport::Node());
   this->AddType(ENTITY);

Unfortunately the static attribute in Light is inherited from the `rootElement` attribute of the World class in #!/osrf/gazebo/src/abb3930b78f2eae44965211145a911fe140e22c1/gazebo/physics/World.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#World.cc-965 , but in the `rootElement` the `static` attribute is not initialized.

pullrequest.title: Fix use of not initialized static attribute in Light class

content.raw: Actually that seems to be the behaviour only for static collision objects.. then I don't really understand what "static" means.
content.html: Actually that seems to be the behaviour only for static collision objects.. then I don't really understand what "static" means.

pull_request.title: Fix use of not initialized static attribute in Light class

pullrequest.title: Fix use of not initialized static attribute in Light class

content.raw:
As far as I understand, static means that the pose of the entity is not managed by the physics engine, but rather is continuously updated by adding a constant rotation + translation on the parent pose (see #!/osrf/gazebo/src/c7202a7fcaf95282bbf54804f36885ad4342111e/gazebo/physics/Entity.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Entity.cc-514). 
That seems exactly the desired behavior when the light will be attached to a link rather then to the world.
content.html: As far as I understand, static means that the pose of the entity is not managed by the physics engine, but rather is continuously updated by adding a constant rotation + translation on the parent pose (see #!/osrf/gazebo/src/c7202a7fcaf95282bbf54804f36885ad4342111e/gazebo/physics/Entity.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Entity.cc-514). That seems exactly the desired behavior when the light will be attached to a link rather then to the world.

pull_request.title: Fix use of not initialized static attribute in Light class

pullrequest.title: Fix use of not initialized static attribute in Light class

content.raw: Eventually we would like to be able to attach lights to links (like a collision or visual), so they might not always be static. This should work for now.
content.html: Eventually we would like to be able to attach lights to links (like a collision or visual), so they might not always be static. This should work for now.
